events.title: Farm-to-Table Cooking Demo
events.description: Learn how to prepare seasonal produce with local chef Maria Gonzalez. Watch as she creates delicious dishes using ingredients available at the market this week. Samples will be provided!

events.title: Beekeeping Workshop
events.description: Local beekeeper Tom Wilson shares the basics of backyard beekeeping. Learn about the importance of pollinators and how you can help support local bee populations.

events.title: Kids' Planting Activity
events.description: Children can plant their own sunflower to take home and watch grow throughout the summer. All materials provided. Suitable for ages 3-10.

events.title: Composting 101
events.description: Learn how to turn your kitchen scraps into garden gold! This workshop covers the basics of home composting and how to troubleshoot common problems.

events.title: Live Music: The Harvest Tones
events.description: Enjoy bluegrass and folk music from this popular local band while you shop the market. Playing from 10am to 1pm.

events.title: Canning and Preserving Workshop
events.description: Learn how to safely preserve your summer harvest with this hands-on workshop. We'll demonstrate water bath canning for jams and pickles.

events.title: Farmers' Market Breakfast
events.description: Join us for a special breakfast featuring dishes made entirely from market ingredients. Tickets required ($15). Proceeds benefit the market's education programs.

events.title: Herb Gardening for Small Spaces
events.description: Even if you only have a windowsill, you can grow fresh herbs! This workshop covers container selection, soil mixes, and care for common culinary herbs.

events.title: Tomato Tasting
events.description: Sample and vote for your favorite heirloom tomato varieties grown by our market farmers. Discover new flavors for your garden!

events.title: Cheese Making Demo
events.description: Watch as the cheesemakers from Mountain View Cheese demonstrate how fresh cheese is made. Samples will be available.

events.title: Fall Planting Workshop
events.description: Learn which vegetables you can plant now for a fall harvest. Includes tips for extending your growing season with cold frames and row covers.

events.title: Apple Pressing Demo
events.description: See how fresh cider is made using a traditional press. Bring your own apples to press (or just watch).

events.title: Pumpkin Decorating
events.description: Kids can decorate a small pumpkin to take home. Pumpkins and decorating supplies provided. First come, first served while supplies last.

events.title: Season Closing Celebration
events.description: Join us for our final market day of the season with live music, special activities, and a thank you to all our vendors and customers.
